name: B
label: Routine B
description: Chord work, ear training, rhythmic accuracy & rhythm playing

exercises.name: Chord Embellishments
exercises.instructions: Practice adding hammer-ons, pull-offs, and other embellishments to dominant 7th chord voicings.

exercises.name: Triad Inversions
exercises.description: Triads and their inversions on one string set. Progression practice.
exercises.instructions: Pick a string group (e.g., D-G-B) and play through triad inversions of a chord progression.

exercises.name: Rhythmic Accuracy
exercises.description: Set metronome to comfortable 16th note speed. Practice accents.
exercises.instructions: Play muted 16th notes and shift the accent pattern. See the PDF accent exercise patterns.

exercises.name: Sing & Play
exercises.description: Sing or hum a phrase and try to play it
exercises.instructions: Pay close attention to the guitar neck. Try to predict where the notes are before finding them.

exercises.name: 3-Note Melodic Motifs
exercises.description: Play a motivic phrase and try to shift it around the neck
exercises.instructions: Create a simple 3-note motif, then transpose it to different positions and keys.

exercises.name: Pentatonic Major/Minor Switches
exercises.description: Practice switching between Major and Minor pentatonic scales
exercises.instructions: Over a static chord, alternate between major and minor pentatonic to hear the tonal shift.

exercises.name: R&B/Funk/Soul Rhythm Playing
exercises.description: Practice playing rhythm to R&B, Funk and Soul backing tracks
exercises.instructions: The switch to a rhythm-focused style will be much more efficient than rock. Focus on groove, ghost notes, and feel.

exercises.name: Vocal Fill Creation
exercises.description: Listen to songs (ideally non-guitar focused) and create fills between vocal lines
exercises.instructions: Don't just imitate the vocal line. Respond to it, complement it. Think conversation, not imitation.
